content: Iâ€™m working on the announcement post now :) Maybe we can review it during our meeting tomorrow?
(Or today, depending on the TZ)
(deleted)
Just a heads up... Itâ€™s very WIP :sweat_smile:

Sure.
Also is that your way of saying "please do not put on your editor hat" or "please put your editor hat all the way on?"
Ah, that's my "editor hat is probably not worth it yet"
I've just started sketching it out
Ok I think the post is ready for a review :smile: I've tried to keep it accessible, but please feel free to go inline edit anything you don't like! https://hackmd.io/_2MnKA4FTEaiac7RR1MG4A
Ah I should list the team in there!
So I should fire up the editor hat?
Please!

Okay, at the end of the document in the "Lokathor Scratch Space" I put a different take on the "what is portable simd?" section. It focuses less on what we'll do internally within the group and more on what it will be like to use the library once we're done.

I like some of the explanation better, but it goes into details a bit that should be in our README instead (which is fine, it'll go somewhere, just thinking it would be best to have some spillover).

I feel the "problem statement" of "You can build vectorized algorithms on std::arch directly, but that could mean sacrificing portability, or having to maintain a different implementation for each CPU you want to support." should be preserved, because it pairs well with "so the goal is that the compiler learns how to sort that out automatically."
Alright, makes sense. Since you're the project's PR face so far I'll leave it up to you how you wanna merge the two versions together.
Resident Hype Queer.
How are we feeling about the announcement post at the moment? Was there anything else we want to line up before publishing it? https://hackmd.io/_2MnKA4FTEaiac7RR1MG4A

I think that @Jubilee was invited to merge some of the "lokathor scratch space" with the main post, but i'm not sure if they had a chance to look at it yet since they were fixing up packed_simd all this evening.
Ah no problem! I'm happy to pull that in
I don't have much strong opinion over the final form, though i think instructions should get replaced with functions or operations like we sorta agreed at the meeting.
Can do!

I did get time, if no one else did? :eyes: Redrafted it here:
https://hackmd.io/P8lA-Lk-SvO0wUH1mmZyPw
Very happy with this version, left a little comment to simplify the language a bit in one sentence, but I'm good with it :thumbs_up:
I put a little more energy into the ##How Can I Get Involved? section.

Instead of adding f32 + f32, you can add two f32x4 in a single step to get a new f32x4.

This part... feels clumsy. I'm not sure we've captured the difference very well.
hmm.
True, it doesn't clarify that the alternative is adding 4 separately
( we're musing in the hackmd for ref. )
it has Iterated.
i think... we're close.

:sparkling_heart: This is Close, for reference. https://hackmd.io/P8lA-Lk-SvO0wUH1mmZyPw
@Ashley Mannix @Caleb Zulawski
Alright. I think we're set.
Excellent
I gave the readme a quick update (https://github.com/rust-lang/stdsimd/pull/4), let's review/merge it before the announce so that people who show up see the extra info.
Awesome!
@Ashley Mannix I suppose you send the announcement post over to someone and then they post it up?
We just PR it up to the main blog repo :smile: Anybody can do it
Well @Jubilee you've been the PR lead so far, or I can do it if you don't care to.
Iâ€™m not in front of a machine right now but the repo should be easy enough to find in the Rust org. Iâ€™m also happy to put it up later today ðŸ™‚
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org seems to be it
As an example, hereâ€™s the Error Handling groupâ€™s announcement post: https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/690
PR is up for the announcement! https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/697
I've also added a catchup meeting for our regular time tomorrow :) It's on the libs calendar
I was too zoned to even say "I'm probably going to be too zoned for the rest of the night to post this" :sweat_smile:
The post is live! I just gave our project repo a quick YOLO-commit to link to stdsimd
Iâ€™ll update the content there more when I get to my desk in a couple mins ðŸ™‚
Awesome! Thanks for getting that through!
I'm going to share the post to reddit today unless someone else would like to do it
(it's where I found this group :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:)
please proceed, I'm not a frequent reddit user myself
go for it.
